commit.message:
QDoc: Move properties test

The `properties` test was already moved from `tst_generatedOutput`
into `tst_validateQdocOutputFiles`. This change modifies the latter
such that it includes the source for this particular test case, and
removes the case from the former.

Task-number: QTBUG-119500
Pick-to: 6.7
Change-Id: Iff241b15ca428ff5077a8bd050ad0a9891eb3031
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Move nestedmacro test

QDoc now has better test infrastructure. Move a trivial test project
from `tst_generatedOutput` into `tst_validateQdocOutputFiles` and
adjust expected output accordingly.

Task-number: QTBUG-119500
Pick-to: 6.7
Change-Id: I122d2aa901d7b8640df3506b89fa559b2742064d
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Move `dontdocument` test

QDoc's new `tst_validateQdocOutputFiles` provides better
infrastructure for testing output generated by QDoc than
`tst_generatedOutput` does. Move the test data for the `dontdocument`
test case of the latter into the `comprehensiveproject` of the former,
and modify the expected output accordingly.

Task-number: QTBUG-119500
Pick-to: 6.7
Change-Id: Ib8ca88ff2e7545c60920b0042c6d8b944ea54722
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Move ignoresince test

With the advent of QDoc's `tst_validateQdocOutputFiles` test, we now
have a better way to test QDoc's generated output. One of the test
cases in the new test represents a rather comprehensive documentation
project. This project was adopted from `tst_generatedOutput`, where it
is known as `TestCPP`.

This change removes a configuration file from `tst_generatedOutput`
and adapts the aforementioned documentation project such that the
behavior remains tested. Expected output files are modified
accordingly.

Task-number: QTBUG-119500
Pick-to: 6.7
Change-Id: Ifa3c7c4fcbfd05c9ed45f989286fabe79995ad4b
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

lupdate: Fix 2 warnings about deprecated Clang API in Clang 18.1

Fix:
llvm: :StringRef clang::FileEntry::getName() const is deprecated: Use FileEntryRef::getName() instead. [-Wdeprecated-declarations]

Pick-to: 6.7

Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

Change-Id: I7a6a7418587ba7c58c1599f464a5b785f6617126
Reviewed-by: Qt Submodule Update Bot <qt_submodule_update_bot@qt-project.org>

Use NO_GENERATE_CPP_EXPORTS explicitly

Use NO_GENERATE_CPP_EXPORTS explicitly for modules that don't need
the autogenerated exports header file.

Task-number: QTBUG-90492
Change-Id: Ib419fa559da8ff7f0368db5966a79f743dcfc45a
Reviewed-by: Alexandru Croitor <alexandru.croitor@qt.io>
Reviewed-by: Friedemann Kleint <Friedemann.Kleint@qt.io>
Reviewed-by: Qt CI Bot <qt_ci_bot@qt-project.org>

CMake: Require libclang 16 for lupdate on MSVC version 1939

The headers of this MSVC version require at least libclang 16, and
running clang-based lupdate will fail with such an error:

error: static assertion failed: error STL1000: Unexpected compiler
version, expected Clang 16.0.0 or newer. _EMIT_STL_ERROR(STL1000,
"Unexpected compiler version, expected Clang 16.0.0 or newer.");

Task-number: QTBUG-123611
Change-Id: I7006a72bd522b6ba7b6368fb5e99fe49b95c845c
Reviewed-by:  Alexey Edelev <alexey.edelev@qt.io>

CMake: Don't disable qdoc if FEATURE_clangcpp is OFF

The fantastically named feature 'clangcpp' is for controlling whether
lupdate is built with libclang. For qdoc, it's sufficient to depend on
the 'clang' feature.

Change-Id: Icde1dd1be216344b5276d10addd2ba24aa290142
Reviewed-by:  Alexey Edelev <alexey.edelev@qt.io>

qdoc: Support auto-generated values in QML docs from C++ enums

C++ classes registered to QML expose also enums to QML, with values
available under <RegisteredQmlName>.<value>.

Add a new meta-command, \qmlenumeratorsfrom, to use in \qmlproperty
documentation. This command is used for associating a documented
C++ enum with a QML property.

The command takes a fully qualified C++ enum as an argument.

When set, the enum values and their descriptions are retrieved from
C++ \enum documentation during generation of the QML property.

Instead of the '<namespace>::' prefix that's used in C++ enum
documentation, use '<RegisteredQmlName>.' as the prefix. By default,
the prefix is the parent QML type name, but a custom prefix can
be provided with the optional argument in brackets.

The auto-generated value table is appended at the end of the
documentation body.

Because QDoc cannot extract documentation from source files outside
the current project, restrict the search for the C++ enum to the
primary tree only. Make Tree::findNodeByNameAndType() a public
function to enable this.

Fixes: QTBUG-92450
Change-Id: If51c6f392e5f20c12a37c585bfd7ef93f23baa15
Reviewed-by: Paul Wicking <paul.wicking@qt.io>

CMake: Fix discrepancy in qt_add_translations .qm output paths

When calling qt_add_translations with automatic target collection we
1. Predict .qm file paths to be in CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR and return
   the paths in QM_FILES_OUTPUT_VARIABLE.
2. Defer the call of qt_add_translations to the end of the PROJECT_DIR
   scope.
3. When running the deferred call, generate .qm files in
   CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR.

The values of CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR in steps 1 and 3 are different if
the call to qt_add_translations is in a subdirectory.

Fix this by passing the .qm output directory to the deferred call of
qt_add_translations and qt_add_lrelease.

Pick-to: 6.7 6.7.0
Fixes: QTBUG-123405
Change-Id: If4a9cdc03ed4659f28ff70c7662f1125a1f59b55
Reviewed-by: Alexandru Croitor <alexandru.croitor@qt.io>
Reviewed-by: Qt CI Bot <qt_ci_bot@qt-project.org>

Doc: Fix wrong qt_add_translations argument

TS_BASE_NAME should be TS_FILE_BASE.

Pick-to: 6.7 6.7.0
Change-Id: Icc9d268d016ea1baee6cdd8c7d36d9ea1d015cd4
Reviewed-by: Alexandru Croitor <alexandru.croitor@qt.io>

Qt Designer: Fix code preview not working in PySide6 on Windows

PySide6 installations do not have a proper Qt directory structure
on Windows; so, uic is not found via libexec. Use the path
of the application instead, which should work in all cases.

Fixes error Unable to launch ...\Lib\site-packages\PySide6\bin\uic: Process failed to start: The system cannot find the file specified.

Change-Id: I841836a89962f4db962816453b9e99f33ffaf86b

Update dependencies on 'dev' in qt/qttools

Change-Id: I670bbca009f7963584e90f2dd500f8299b9536c1
Reviewed-by: Qt Submodule Update Bot <qt_submodule_update_bot@qt-project.org>

CMake: Fix 'file to open is a directory' on update_translations

To feed lupdate a list of source files we generate a .cmake file with a
$<TARGET_PROPERTY:foo,SOURCES> expression. Apparently, this list of
sources can contain empty entries, stemming from INTERFACE_SOURCES with
generator expressions that evaluate to the empty string.

Filter out those empty entries when generating lupdate's .json file from
that .cmake file.

Pick-to: 6.7 6.7.0
Fixes: QTBUG-123338
Change-Id: I1dc383d6c75da7af560a50071c390f18321be066
Reviewed-by: Alexandru Croitor <alexandru.croitor@qt.io>

QDoc: Move getMoreArgs outside ClangCodeParser

When QDoc processes a project, it parses its code-base to obtain and
sanitize the user-provided documentation for the project.

For projects that makes use of C++ code, QDoc uses Clang's APIs to
obtain the required information about the code-base.

Profiling shows that calls to Clang are the major bottleneck in QDoc at
the current time.

To reduce the time spent by Clang, QDoc is being moved to parallelize
and batch certain operations that are related to Clang calls.

`ClangCodeParser`, the component responsible for all of the calls to
Clang libraries, is currently architectured in a way that is not usable
for those optimization purposes.

Hence, it is slowly being modified to be better suited for those
purposes.
As part of those modification, we expect `ClangCodeParser` to be split
into multiple components.

Currently, `ClangCodeParser` is the entry point to a series of
operations that happen in different phases and have very different
restriction on their scopes and their dependencies.

Some of those operation shares some internal state that
an instance of `ClangCodeParser` keeps.

To allow for splitting those various operations up, we need to be able
to pass this shared data around the code-base to all relevant parties.

`ClangCodeParser::getMoreArgs` populates an internal vector,
`m_moreArgs`, one such shared state, to contain some specific arguments we
pass to some Clang's based compilations.

As this will be required by multiple parts that are expected to be split
around, `getMoreArgs` was now moved outside `ClangCodeParser` as a free
function.

The dependent state for the function was modified to be passed as
arguments instead of being taken directly from an instance state.

`getMoreArgs` is called many times in the current QDoc, albeit this
will be lowered in the future, so that it is a very hot path.

`m_moreArgs`, that was populated by `getMoreArgs`, was an instance state
to avoid allocating a new vector many times. As this seems to still be
impactful at the current moment, `getMoreArgs` now takes a mutable
out-argument that represent the vector where the arguments should be
stored, so that the lifetime of the vector can be managed outside of it,
as `m_moreArgs` does.

Usages of `getMoreArgs` were modified to abide to the new interface.

`ClangCodeParser` has a second `m_args` vector that is populated with
default arguments that we use for all compilations.
Every time `m_moreArgs` was populated, its contents would then be
appended to `m_args`, which was used to pass the actual arguments when
compiling.

With the new interface `m_moreArgs` is unnecessary, as we can pass and
populate `m_args` directory in `getMoreArgs`.

Thus `ClangCodeParser::m_moreArgs` is removed.

Task-number: QTBUG-111686
Change-Id: Ic4eebe803b6f8d6e88358f6a51f71e2d07d54b50
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Move getDefaultArgs outside ClangCodeParser

When QDoc processes a project, it parses its code-base to obtain and
sanitize the user-provided documentation for the project.

For projects that makes use of C++ code, QDoc uses Clang's APIs to
obtain the required information about the code-base.

Profiling shows that calls to Clang are the major bottleneck in QDoc at
the current time.

To reduce the time spent by Clang, QDoc is being moved to parallelize
and batch certain operations that are related to Clang calls.

`ClangCodeParser`, the component responsible for all of the calls to
Clang libraries, is currently architectured in a way that is not usable
for those optimization purposes.

Hence, it is slowly being modified to be better suited for those
purposes.
As part of those modification, we expect `ClangCodeParser` to be split
into multiple components.

Currently, `ClangCodeParser` is the entry point to a series of
operations that happen in different phases and have very different
restriction on their scopes and their dependencies.

Some of those operation shares some internal state that
an instance of `ClangCodeParser` keeps.

To allow for splitting those various operations up, we need to be able
to pass this shared data around the code-base to all relevant parties.

`ClangCodeParser::getDefaultArgs` populates and internal vector,
`m_args`, one such shared state, to contain the general arguments we
pass to all Clang's based compilations.

As this will be required by multiple parts that are expected to be split
around, `getMoreArgs` was now moved outside `ClangCodeParser` as a free
function.

The dependent state for the function was modified to be passed as
arguments instead of being taken directly from an instance state.

`getDefaultArgs` is called many times in the current QDoc, albeit this
will be lowered in the future, so that it is a very hot path.

`m_args`, that was populated by `getDefaultArgs`, was an instance state
to avoid allocating a new vector many times. As this seems to still be
impactful at the current moment, `getDefaultArgs` now takes a mutable
out-argument that represent the vector where the arguments should be
stored, so that the lifetime of the vector can be managed outside of it,
as `m_args` does.

Usages of `getDefaultArgs` were modified to abide to the new interface.

Task-number: QTBUG-111686
Change-Id: I9da5c8e09606b5b3d665dbed2816e08724012ff1
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Move defines processing outside ClangCodeParser

When QDoc processes a project, it parses its code-base to obtain and
sanitize the user-provided documentation for the project.

For projects that makes use of C++ code, QDoc uses Clang's APIs to
obtain the required information about the code-base.

Profiling shows that calls to Clang are the major bottleneck in QDoc at
the current time.

To reduce the time spent by Clang, QDoc is being moved to parallelize
and batch certain operations that are related to Clang calls.

`ClangCodeParser`, the component responsible for all of the calls to
Clang libraries, is currently architectured in a way that is not usable
for those optimization purposes.

Hence, it is slowly being modified to be better suited for this
purposes.
As part of those modification, we expect `ClangCodeParser` to be split
into multiple components.

Currently, `ClangCodeParser` is the entry point to a series of
operations that happen in different phases and have very different
restriction on their scopes and their dependencies.

Some of those operation shares some internal state that
an instance of `ClangCodeParser` keeps.

To allow for splitting those various operations up, we need to be able
to pass this shared data around the code-base to all relevant parties.

One such datum is `ClangCodeParser::m_defines`, which is used at various
times to instrument the "-D" arguments for a compilation performed by
Clang's APIs.

Due to the current structure of the code, this processing is performed a
single time by `ClangCodeParser` itself, stored and used multiple times.

The processing steps for `m_defines` that were performed in the
constructor for `ClangCodeParser` is now moved to the main loop of a
QDoc execution.

The constructor for `ClangCodeParser` was modified to obtain a reference
to the required defines data and store it in `m_defines`.

Task-number: QTBUG-111686
Change-Id: I45c2e208090ce29dc249add73e19c96c048f20b3
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Move include paths processing outside ClangCodeParser

When QDoc processes a project, it parses its code-base to obtain and
sanitize the user-provided documentation for the project.

For projects that makes use of C++ code, QDoc uses Clang's APIs to
obtain the required information about the code-base.

Profiling shows that calls to Clang are the major bottleneck in QDoc at
the current time.

To reduce the time spent by Clang, QDoc is being moved to parallelize
and batch certain operations that are related to Clang calls.

`ClangCodeParser`, the component responsible for all of the calls to
Clang libraries, is currently architectured in a way that is not usable
for those optimization purposes.

Hence, it is slowly being modified to be better suited for this
purposes.
As part of those modification, we expect `ClangCodeParser` to be split
into multiple components.

Currently, `ClangCodeParser` is the entry point to a series of
operations that happen in different phases and have very different
restriction on their scopes and their dependencies.

Some of those operation shares some internal state that
an instance of `ClangCodeParser` keeps.

To allow for splitting those various operations up, we need to be able
to pass this shared data around the code-base to all relevant parties.

One such datum is `ClangCodeParser::m_includePaths`, which is at various
times to instrument the include paths for a compilation performed by
Clang's APIs.

`ClangCodeParser` performs some relatively expensive processing to
obtain those include paths.
Due to the current structure of the code, this processing is performed a
single time by `ClangCodeParser` itself, stored and used multiple times.

We don't want to perform the required processing more than required as
it can be expensive, such that the processing that `ClangCodeParser` was
performing is now moved to the main loop, where it can later be passed
around as required.

The processing steps for `m_includePaths` that were performed in the
constructor for `ClangCodeParser` is now moved to the main loop of a
QDoc execution.

The constructor for `ClangCodeParser` was modified to obtain a reference
to the required include paths data and store it in `m_includePaths`,
whose type was changed accordingly, instead of processing it itself.

The type of the data was slightly changed, from a `QList` to an
`std::vector` and usages of it were changed accordingly.

The "utilities.h" header is now not included by "clangcodeparser.cpp"
anymore.
It was included only to access certain operations required by the
processing of the include paths data and is now unnecessary.

Task-number: QTBUG-111686
Change-Id: Ia86bacf34dbefbc74ae908fa8c402ba2286627e4
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Remove ClangCodeParser::parseHeaderFile

When QDoc processes a project, it parses its code-base to extract and
sanitize the user provided documentation.

When a C++ project is processed, QDoc requires a list of headers files
that should be considered when parsing the code-base.

Currently, the list of headers files is provided by the user through the
project configuration.

Internally, QDoc uses its `Config` singleton, which is used to represent
the content of a configuration file, to obtain a list of headers that
should be considered.

`Config` is built as a generic key-value store, so that it provides
certain "raw" values that are later processed by its consumers.

The main loop for QDoc obtains this list, processes it slighlty and then
iterates it and passes each of the headers to
`ClangCodeParser::parseHeaderFile`.

`ClangCodeParser` is the component taking care of parsing C++ header and
source files.

`parseHeaderFile` does not in fact parse the header file. Indeed, QDoc
always uses a PCH file that it build in `ClangCodeParser::buildPCH` when
parsing the code-base for a C++ project.

Instead, `parseHeaderFile` performs some additional processing for the
list of headers and then store the results into a member variable of
`ClangCodeParser`.

To avoid having the processing of the header list split over multiple
components, to simplify the interface of `ClangCodeParser` and to
prepare for additional changes to `ClangCodeParser` internal state to
facilitate an effort to parallelize certain parts of QDoc,
`paseHeaderFile` is now removed.

The declaration of `parseHeaderFile` in `clangcodeparser.h` and its
definition in the relevant implementation file were removed.

A new member function of `Config`, `getHeaderFiles`, was added.
`getHeaderFiles` centralizes the processing we currently perform on the
list of header files, such as the removal of duplicates.

It returns a set of `HeaderFilePath`, a small structure that decomposes
the path to an header file, as extracted from the configuration file,
into its path and filename.
This decomposition is later used in `ClangCodeParser`, where access to
both the path and the filename of an header file is currently required.

The code taking performing the now centralized processing is removed.
The code extracting the list of header files and passing it to
`parseHeaderFile` in the main loop of QDoc is removed along with the single
usage of `parseHeaderFile` itself.

Previously, `ClangCodeParser::accepted_header_file_extension` was used
to filter the list of header files based on their extension.

As the processing is now centralized to `getHeaderFiles`,
`ClangCodeParser::accepted_header_file_extension` was removed and an
equivalent of it was introduced in the scope of `getHeaderFiles`, where
it is used for the same purpose.

The internal state that the various calls to `parseHeaderFile`
initialized is now initialized in the constructor for `ClangCodeParser`,
based on a usage of `getHeaderFiles` as called from the `Config`
dependency of the constructor.

Due to an implementation detail of `getHeaderFiles` which disallows it
from being a `const` member of `Config`, the dependency on `Config` for
the constructor of `ClangCodeParser` was modified to be a mutable
reference from a `const` reference.

`ClangCodeParser::m_allHeaders`, which contains the finalized list of
headers that was populated in `parseHeaderFile`, and is used all around
`ClangCodeParser`, was modified to respect the new type returned by
`getHeaderFiles`.

Usages of `m_allHeaders` were modified where required to work with the
new typing.

Task-number: QTBUG-111686
Change-Id: I3b554eaca246514d87d29a9082e5936b20df0c93
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

QDoc: Add Config::getExcludedPaths

QDoc uses a singleton `Config` structure to represent and manage the
values defined by a ".qdocconf" file, the configuration file that
defines a project that QDoc can process.

The structure act as a very generic key-value store and generally
provides access only to "raw" values as extracted from a configuration
files.

In turn, the parts of the code that depend on those values generally
perform additional processing to "get them into shape" so that they can
be used.

For certain values, the same processing is performed in multiple part of
the code-base, increasing code-duplication and the opportunity for
error.

For example, a configuration file allow a user to provide a series of
paths that should be excluded from searches that QDoc performs on the
filesystem.

With the current setup, consumers of those excluded paths extract the
"raw" values that the user provided as a list of string, which is then
processed into a set to remove duplicates and provide sorting.

To avoid repeating this processing over multiple parts of the code-base,
a new method, `Config::getExcludedPaths`, was added that return an
already processed set of directories and files to exclude.

The implementation of `Config::getExcludedPaths` performes the same
process that the consumer of those configuration elements did: the list
of excluded files and directories are extracted as raw values from the
configuration so that they can be collected into two sets, which are
used as the "processed" values of those variables.

A record, `ExcludedPaths`, to use a the return value for
`getExcludedPaths`, was added to `Config` to contain the pair of sets
that the "processed" exclusion variables take the form of.

To avoid performing the same process multiple times, considering that
the value of those configuration variables is static, an additional
optional member, `m_excludedPaths`, was added.
`m_excludedPaths` is used to cache the computation between calls to
`getExcludedPaths`.

As `Config` is a singleton that is reused multiple times,
`Config::clear`, which is used when "resetting" the instance to be
reused, was modified to clean the cached value, so that the computation
can be reprocessed when a new configuration file is loaded.

Consumers of the excluded variables were modified to use the new
`getExcludedPaths`.

One of the consumers, `CppCodeParser`, would provides its own caching
mechanism for the processed value of the excluded variables.

As `Config` now performs the caching process, this is not required
anymore.

Hence, `CppCodeParser::m_excludeDirs` and
`CppCodeParser::m_excludeFiles`, the caching member for the excluded
variables in `CppCodeParser`, were removed and substituted with usages
of `Config::getExcludedPaths`.

Task-number: QTBUG-111686
Change-Id: I83f9d3a76cdb9eff70c9cb0596d80072ed4bb3f3
Reviewed-by: Topi Reiniö <topi.reinio@qt.io>

Task-number: QTBUG-121787
Change-Id: I699bab8ade0448b02251729ed5dd85c3a97e4000
Reviewed-by: Kai Köhne <kai.koehne@qt.io>
